titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T19:52-0400

did.abstract: Eight of these enclosures contain a scrapbook of notes, newspaper clippings, photographs, about the paintings of Charles Willson Peale and Rembrandt Peale.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Charles Coleman Sellers and accessioned, 08/--/1953. See in-house shelf list for additional accession dates.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: The papers of C. W. Peale and his family have been reproduced almost in their entirety in microfiche form (Lillian B. Miller, ed. "Collected papers of Charles Willson Peale and his family." Kraus Microfilm, 1980).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The American Philosophical Society Library also has the Charles Coleman Sellers Papers, which contain similar material (Ms. Coll. #3).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The main body of the Peale Collection is described in brief in American Philosophical Society "Year Book" 1945:74-77.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Coleman Sellers was the great-grandson of Charles Willson Peale, who was an artist and naturalist. Sellers wrote a biography of Charles Willson Peale (New York: Scribner, 1969).

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.
